om.stdcomponent
Class LayoutGridComponent

java.lang.Object
  om.stdquestion.QComponent
      om.stdcomponent.LayoutGridComponent

public class LayoutGridComponent
extends QComponent

A layout grid that arranges child components in a certain number of equal-size columns.

XML usage

<layoutgrid cols='2'>...</layoutgrid>

Properties

PropertyValuesEffect
cols(integer)Number of columns
id(string)Specifies unique ID
display(boolean)Includes in/removes from output
enabled(boolean)Activates/deactivates children
lang(string)Specifies the language of the content, like the HTML lang attribute. For example 'en' = English, 'el' - Greek, ...
shuffle(boolean)If true, randomises order of children
widths(string)Comma-separated lists of percentages for each column (defaults to equal division) e.g. "30%,30%,40%". Must add up to 100% and specify every column.

defineProperties

protected void defineProperties()
                         throws OmDeveloperException
Description copied from class: QComponent
Intended for overriding. Default allows 'id' and 'display', so do remember to call superclass if you override or you won't get these.

Basically call defineProperty a bunch of times to set up all your properties. If you wish to set initial property values you can do that here too.

Overrides:
defineProperties in class QComponent
Throws:
OmDeveloperException

produceVisibleOutput

public void produceVisibleOutput(QContent qc,
                                 boolean bInit,
                                 boolean bPlain)
                          throws OmException
Description copied from class: QComponent
Builds up content of this component that should end up in question output. Only called if the 'display' property is set to true.

Default implementation just calls produceChildOutput().

Overrides:
produceVisibleOutput in class QComponent
Parameters:
qc - Output variable that accepts question content
bInit - True if this is first call in question initialisation
Throws:
OmException - If whatever error occurs
